intro: Galium pennellii, commonly known as the Pennsylvania bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, often hairy stems that lie close to the ground. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium pennellii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks.
